result.execSummary:
The defendant Renado Jackson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. On one or more other charges, Renado Jackson was found not guilty. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Renado Jackson is presumed innocent of the not guilty charges.

  • Renado Jackson was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Found Not Guilty at Jury Trial

charges.dispoDesc: Found Not Guilty at Jury Trial

2:31 State there is another issue to be addresse today squad audio of two witnesses.  Sasa Johnen don't feel it is my position to get those records.  I followed the order.  State do not intend to use it.  COURT:  YOU HAVE A DAY AND HALF TO REVIEW THAT, THAT ISSUE IS RESOLVED 
State comments on witness issue.  There are four convictions.  Do not see any prejudice that the defense would suffer.  Defense - information should of been turned over.  We are asking for a sanction.  We asked for htis 6 months ago in a discovery request.  COURT:  I THINK YOU SHOULD OF CHECKED CCAP AND REVIEWED TO SEE WHAT IS OUT THERE.  NO PREJUDICE TO YOU.
